additionalInfo.details: We are directly connected to the McGill metro station, on the green line. Located in the heart of the Montréal underground city, the Eaton Centre can also be reached from Bonaventure metro and Square-Victoria–OACI.
additionalInfo.title: Metro

additionalInfo.details: Bus number 15 stops right at the door of the Montréal Eaton Centre, going west on Maisonneuve and going east on Saint-Catherine. Nearby, you can also catch buss number 24 on Sherbrooke and 150 on René-Lévesque. If you're travelling north, take bus line 61 or 168, which will drop you off at the street corner.
additionalInfo.title: Bus

additionalInfo.details: The Deux-Montagnes and Mont-Saint-Hilaire train lines will bring you minutes from the Eaton Centre, dropping you off at Central Station. The Saint-Jérôme, Vaudreuil-Hudson and Candiac lines will drop you off at Lucien-L’Allier station, where you can catch the Metro.
additionalInfo.title: Suburban Trains

infoList.subtitle: See public transportation information and schedules
infoList.title: Public Transportation
infoList.details: Montréal Eaton Centre is easily accessible via public transit.

infoList.subtitle: Learn more about the Montréal Eaton Centre
infoList.details: Located in the heart of Montréal on Canada's largest shopping strip, and door to the famous underground city, the Montréal Eaton Centre has over the years become home to prominent attractions downtown. Each year the Centre welcomes 30 million visitors. The number one shopping destination in the city, the Montréal Eaton Centre features 175 shops and restaurants, as well as the famous Grévin Montréal wax museum, all spread over 5 floors. The Centre also features one of the largest food courts in North America, with free wireless Internet access. Steeped in the excitement and creativity that make Montréal such a fascinating city, the Montréal Eaton Centre is proud to regularly host artistic and cultural events.
infoList.title: About the Montréal Eaton Centre
